abstract.p: Endesa, leading Spanish power company, is in talks about possible merger with country's second-largest electricity producer, Iberdrola, which would create one of biggest utilities in Europe and be among the top 10 in the world (S)

block.p: Endesa, the leading Spanish power company is in talks about a possible merger with the country's second-largest electricity producer, Iberdrola, which would create one of the biggest utilities in Europe and be among the top 10 in the world. Spanish government regulators are expected to examine the details closely to ensure that it does not violate competition rules. Earlier this year, the government blocked a merger of the power companies Unin Fenosa and Hidroelectrica del Cantabrico over antitrust concerns. Endesa and Iberdrola control more than 80 percent of the electrical power market and have a combined value of more than $31 billion.
